Class Controller

java.lang.Object
MVC.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
IControllerMtoV, IControllerVtoM
public class Controller extends Object implements IControllerVtoM, IControllerMtoV
Controller serves as the intermediary between the simulation model and the user interface, implementing the Controller component of the MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture.

This class manages the simulation engine lifecycle, controls the speed of the simulation, and ensures thread-safe communication between the simulation engine thread and the JavaFX UI thread. It implements both IControllerVtoM for view-to-model communication and IControllerMtoV for model-to-view communication.

Key responsibilities include:
  • Starting and managing simulation engine instances
  • Controlling simulation speed through delay adjustments
  • Routing simulation results and updates to the UI thread
  • Managing visualization updates for customer movement and queue status
  • Coordinating statistics display updates
See IControllerVtoM See IControllerMtoV See IEngine See ISimulatorUI

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller(ISimulatorUI ui, DistributionConfig[] configs, Long seed)
      Constructs a Controller with the specified UI, distribution configurations, and random seed.
      Parameters:
      ui - the user interface component
      configs - array of distribution configurations for service points
      seed - random seed for simulation reproducibility

  • Method Details

    • startSimulation

      public void startSimulation()
      Starts a new simulation by creating a fresh engine instance, configuring it with simulation parameters from the UI, clearing the visualization display, and starting the engine thread.

      A new engine thread is created for every simulation run to ensure clean state.

      Specified by:
      startSimulation in interface IControllerVtoM

    • decreaseSpeed

      public void decreaseSpeed()
      Decreases the simulation speed by increasing the delay between simulation steps. The delay is multiplied by 1.10, making the simulation run approximately 10% slower.
      Specified by:
      decreaseSpeed in interface IControllerVtoM

    • increaseSpeed

      public void increaseSpeed()
      Increases the simulation speed by decreasing the delay between simulation steps. The delay is multiplied by 0.9, making the simulation run approximately 10% faster.
      Specified by:
      increaseSpeed in interface IControllerVtoM

    • showEndTime

      public void showEndTime(double time)
      Displays the simulation end time in the UI.

      This method is called from the engine thread and uses Platform.runLater to ensure the UI update occurs on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      showEndTime in interface IControllerMtoV
      Parameters:
      time - the final simulation time to display

    • visualiseCustomer

      public void visualiseCustomer()
      Triggers visualization of a new customer entering the system.

      This method is called from the engine thread and uses Platform.runLater to ensure the visualization update occurs on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      visualiseCustomer in interface IControllerMtoV

    • updateQueueStatus

      public void updateQueueStatus(int servicePointId, int queueSize)
      Updates the queue status display for a specific service point.

      This method is called from the engine thread and uses Platform.runLater to ensure the UI update occurs on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      updateQueueStatus in interface IControllerMtoV
      Parameters:
      servicePointId - the identifier of the service point
      queueSize - the current number of customers in the queue

    • displayResults

      public void displayResults(String resultsText)
      Displays simulation results text in the UI.

      This method is called from the engine thread and uses Platform.runLater to ensure the UI update occurs on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      displayResults in interface IControllerMtoV
      Parameters:
      resultsText - the formatted results text to display

    • getVisualisation

      public IVisualisation getVisualisation()
      Retrieves the visualization component for direct access to visualization operations.

      This method provides access to the component responsible for rendering the simulation's visual display.

      Specified by:
      getVisualisation in interface IControllerMtoV
      Returns:
      the visualization component

    • updateStatistics

      public void updateStatistics(int totalApps, int approved, int rejected, double avgTime, double currentTime)
      Updates the real-time statistics display in the UI with current simulation metrics.

      This method is called from the engine thread and uses Platform.runLater to ensure the UI update occurs on the JavaFX Application Thread. The statistics are only updated if the UI implements SimulationController.

      Specified by:
      updateStatistics in interface IControllerMtoV
      Parameters:
      totalApps - total number of applications processed
      approved - number of approved applications
      rejected - number of rejected applications
      avgTime - average processing time per application
      currentTime - current simulation time

    • getEngine

      public IEngine getEngine()
      Retrieves the current simulation engine instance.

      This method provides access to the engine for control operations such as pausing and stopping the simulation.

      Specified by:
      getEngine in interface IControllerVtoM
      Returns:
      the current engine instance
